results.title: Catchment Boards at work: Nelson
results.creator_credit: Apex Films and New Zealand National Film Unit
results.brief_description: How cultivation of the Nelson Province is being extended by scientific treatment of the soil; also, how further erosion is being prevented by control of the river catchments. Shows the co-ordinated program in the upper catchment areas and river control in the lower parts of the district. Commentary by Bill Beavis. Photography by George Hobbs.

results.title: Catamarans
results.creator_credit: Ian Curtis, BBC-TV and West Region Film Unit
results.brief_description: Catamarans, those sailing craft originating from the Pacific with two slender hulls spread apart to give high sail-carrying and stability, have become very popular in England. David Lutyens commentates the film which shows various types of this boat, from the simplest model to the sixty-three foot long passenger craft, and ends with shots of a Catamaran Regatta.

results.title: Catalysis
results.brief_description: A study of catalysis as fourth factor in the velocity of chemical reactions. Explains how catalyst function by absorbing molecules, activating molecules forming an intermediate compound, or starting a chain reaction. Illustrates application of negative catalysts in the manufacture of rubber and anti-knock gasoline.

results.title: Catalysis
results.creator_credit: Millbank Films and Stewart Hardy Films
results.brief_description: Role of catalysis in lowering activation energy explained. Use on platinum gauze in production of nitric acid described, also role of Ti CL3 in polymerization of propene. Model of lysozyme with active site shown. Catalase activity in blood demonstrated. Animation by Stewart Hardy Films.

results.title: A Cat is a cat...
results.brief_description: An informative and entertaining animated film narrated by children and set to a Beethoven score. It offers facts about cats and provides insight into animal behaviour. A variety of cat stereotypes are shown. Suitable for primary school level.

results.title: The Cat and the fiddler
results.creator_credit: Jane Startz, Jeffrey Hayes, ACI Films and Thomas Sand Enterprises
results.brief_description: Tells the story of a travelling fiddler and his dancing cat whose performances earns a living for both of them. The king tries to buy the cat, however it will only dance for the fiddler. He plays but the court and the king cannot stop dancing. Based on the book by Jacky Jeter, illustrated by Lionel kalish. The original illustrations from the book are used in the film. Suitable for primary school level.

results.title: The Cat and the collector
results.creator_credit: Morton Schindel and Weston Woods Studios
results.brief_description: A film which tells a story with drawings of how an old man befriends a stray cat and learns about the nature of cats. Based on the book of the same title written and illustrated by Linda Slovach. Narrated by Emery Battis. Suitable for primary school level.

results.title: Casuarina Equisetifolia
results.brief_description: One of a group of four films which look at various species of native trees growing on Stradbroke Island, Queensland. This film is about a species of pine tree called Casuarina Equisetifolia. Groves of these graceful trees grow on the rocky slopes above the ocean where cicadas hum in their branches and the long clusters of Casuarina needles shimmer silver and black in the breeze. The film follows the development of the small cones. The song of the small brown Honey-eater is heard on the sound track mixed in with the sound of a solo flute. Music performed by Nancy Tow.

results.title: Castles and country: a view of Scotland
results.creator_credit: Shirley Cobham, National Benzole and Random Films
results.brief_description: Illustrates the work of the National Trust for Scotland in preserving castles, palaces, historical sites such as Glencoe, Iona, and the gardens of Crarae, Ardkinglass and Inverewe. Each sequence beings with a close-up, then opens out to a general view enabling appreciation of the architectural line or scene.

results.title: Castles and castanets
results.creator_credit: Henry Strauss Productions and Pan American World Airways
results.brief_description: Romantic Spain, warm with life and colour is the subject of this film. We see different aspects of its life - a hardworking farmer, a fisherman, a lady from Granada. The names themselves are evocative - Seville, seen at carnival time, the religious pageants in Malaga, Madrid with its new hotels and shops, the Costa Brava - and bull-fighting.
